alerts.title: Geographic Correlation Detected: Dallas Area
alerts.description: 3 suspicious job postings found in Dallas coinciding with news coverage of questionable rally attendance at recent city council meetings. Job listings reference 'rally support' and 'event staffing' - common astroturf terminology.

alerts.title: High-Risk Organization Cluster in Texas
alerts.description: 4 organizations with generic patriotic naming patterns (Citizens for Freedom, Texas Freedom Alliance, etc.) filed with FEC in the past 6 months. This clustering pattern is consistent with coordinated astroturf campaign infrastructure.

alerts.title: Paid Protest News Surge
alerts.description: 6 news articles in the past 48 hours specifically mention 'paid protesters' or 'paid actors' at public events. Coverage spans Texas Tribune, Vice News, and AP. This indicates heightened media scrutiny of astroturf activity.

alerts.title: Crowds on Demand Activity Increase
alerts.description: News reports indicate Crowds on Demand, the largest known paid crowd company, has seen a 400% increase in business requests. This suggests elevated demand for manufactured grassroots support.

alerts.title: Energy Sector Astroturf Pattern
alerts.description: Multiple energy companies referenced in recent news coverage as using paid attendees at public hearings. Pattern mirrors the documented 2018 Entergy New Orleans case that resulted in a $5M fine.
